comments: simplexes such as triangles or tetrahedrals (T) or quadrilaterals (Q)
lumped, equispaced or DG, default is lumped
(MLT/spectral_quadrilateral/DG_triangle/DG_quadrilateral) You can either specify a cell_type+variant or a method
p order
dimension
Number of cores for the shot. For simplicity, we keep things serial.
spyro however supports both spatial parallelism and "shot" parallelism.
options: automatic (same number of cores for evey processor) or spatial
Define the domain size without the PML. Here we'll assume a 0.75 x 1.50 km
domain and reserve the remaining 250 m for the Perfectly Matched Layer (PML) to absorb
outgoing waves on three sides (eg., -z, +-x sides) of the domain.
depth in km - always positive
width in km - always positive
thickness in km - always positive
For use only if you are using a synthetic test model
Specify a 250-m PML on the three sides of the domain to damp outgoing waves.
True or false
None or non-reflective (outer boundary condition)
polynomial, hyperbolic, shifted_hyperbolic
damping layer has a exponent variation
maximum acoustic wave velocity in PML - km/s
theoretical reflection coefficient
thickness of the PML in the z-direction (km) - always positive
thickness of the PML in the x-direction (km) - always positive
thickness of the PML in the y-direction (km) - always positive
Create a source injection operator. Here we use a single source with a
Ricker wavelet that has a peak frequency of 8 Hz injected at the center of the mesh.
We also specify to record the solution at 101 microphones near the top of the domain.
This transect of receivers is created with the helper function `create_transect`.
Simulate for 2.0 seconds.
Initial time for event
Final time for event
timestep size
the Ricker has an amplitude of 1.
how frequently to output solution to pvds
how frequently to save solution to RAM
